rfq_input:
We need comprehensive research on AI-powered diagnostic tools adoption in mid-sized hospitals (100-500 beds). 
        Key focus areas: decision-making hierarchy, budget approval processes, clinical staff acceptance, patient privacy concerns, 
        ROI expectations, integration challenges with existing HIS/EMR systems, regulatory compliance barriers, 
        and competitive landscape analysis for vendors like GE Healthcare, Philips, and Siemens Healthineers.
        Include KANO model analysis for feature prioritization and discrete choice modeling for pricing sensitivity.
        Target: C-suite executives, CIOs, Chief Medical Officers, and department heads. Need 150+ qualified responses.

generated_survey.title: AI-Powered Diagnostic Tools Adoption in Mid-Sized Hospitals
generated_survey.description: Survey to assess adoption drivers, barriers, pricing sensitivity, and feature priorities for AI diagnostic tools in 100–500 bed hospitals.

questions.text: What is your role in technology/clinical solution decisions?
Which statement best describes your hospital’s current status with AI-powered diagnostic tools (e.g., radiology AI, pathology AI)?
Who are the key decision-makers and approvers for AI diagnostic tool purchases in your hospital? Select all that apply.
What is the typical budget approval process length for AI diagnostic tools from business case to final sign-off?
Please rate your agreement with the following regarding adoption barriers. (1=Strongly Disagree, 5=Strongly Agree)
options: Integration with HIS/EMR is a major challenge
Regulatory compliance (e.g., FDA/CE/MDR/HIPAA) is a major barrier
Clinician acceptance and workflow fit are concerns
Patient privacy and data security concerns are significant
Lack of high-quality data/IT resources limits deployment

questions.text: For each feature, indicate how you would feel if the product had it and if it did NOT have it (KANO pairs).

options.feature: Explainable AI outputs with confidence scores
Automated QA and bias monitoring dashboards

questions.text: Assuming a mid-sized hospital deployment, what 1-year ROI threshold would justify adoption?
options: ROI not primary; focus on clinical outcomes/safety

questions.text: Discrete Choice: Please choose the option you would most likely purchase.
options: Option A: $250k/yr subscription; top-3 EMR certified integration; basic explainability; 99.5% uptime; vendor: Established (GE/Philips/Siemens).
Option B: $150k/yr; API integration only; advanced explainability; 99.0% uptime; vendor: Emerging.
Option C: $350k/yr; turnkey integration + workflow tools; bias monitoring; 99.9% uptime; vendor: Established.
Option D: $200k/yr; turnkey integration; limited explainability; 99.5% uptime; vendor: Established.

questions.text: Which vendors are you actively considering or have deployed? Select all that apply.
Please describe any specific integration challenges with your current HIS/EMR (vendor names, interfaces, data standards).
Demographics: Region, bed count, and annual IT budget range.
